Class DirectedGraph<V,A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DirectedGraph<V,A>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of data associated with nodes in this graph
    A - the type of data associated with arcs in this graph

    public class DirectedGraph<V,A>
extends Object
    Simple class that can be used to model directed graphs, where arbitrary types of data are associated with the nodes and arcs of the graph. Note that this implementation of an arc allows multiple copies of the same arc. As such, it can not be assumed that graphs stored by instances of this class are simple; they can be multigraphs. It is assumed that the data type associated with the nodes has a consistent implementation of hashCode() and equals().
    Author:
    Paul Bouman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectedGraph()
      Creates an empty graph with no nodes or arcs.

        Parameters:
        from - the origin node of the arc to be added
        to - the destination of the arc to be added
        arcData - the data associated with the arc
        Throws:
